poem:
Title: "The Jester's Riches"

A jester cloaked in words, weighted with truth,
stamps his foot onto the stage,
four women in keffiyehs, the altar of his youth,
celebrate his jest, his wise-foolage.
In this capital, under deceptive lights he fights,
throwing barbed jests, without any fear,
in a world of twisted rights, 
he is the laughter, shedding a tear.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘The media and politicians are failing’: comedian Bassem Youssef on Piers Morgan, satire and ‘Genocide Joe’ When the comedian Bassem Youssef arrives on stage for a sold-out show in Washington DC, four young women wearing keffiyehs bow their heads and begin waving their hands up and down as if he is a divine being. Related: Israeli Eurovision song under ‘scrutiny’ for alleged Hamas attack reference The 49-year-old, who first found fame with a satirical show". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
